firstView.catchCopy: A library for game researchers with the aim of "facilitating game research and contributing to the development of game research"

features.title: What you can do with OVGL

feature1.title: Finding games to use in your research
feature1.description: You can find and use open video games that we have created to be used in your research, or external open source games that you can edit to suit your research.

feature2.title: Find tools to use in your research
feature2.description: You can find and use recording functions and questionnaires that are useful when conducting experiments to evaluate experiences and devices with games.

feature3.title: Deepen your knowledge of game research
feature3.description: You will be able to find out information that will be useful for game development and points to keep in mind when conducting game research.

game.title: Open Video Games
game.description: Open Video Game is released under the {license}. Please see {gitHub} for more information. For the design and development of each open video game, please click {survey}.

parameter.title: Parameter Adjustment and Retrieval
parameter.description: Open video games allow you to adjust and retrieve parameters without writing code.

adjustment.title: Adjustment
adjustment.description: Parameter adjustment allows for easy adjustment of game difficulty and specifications to suit the experimental environment and other circumstances. In addition to numerical adjustments, visual adjustments can also be made by replacing images.

retrieval.title: Retrieval
retrieval.description: It is possible to obtain internal game data that cannot be ascertained by observation alone. It can be used for evaluation and analysis of game experience and controller devices.

internal.title: Tools
internal.description: We develop and provide tools that can be used for experimentation and evaluation of game research.

external.title: External Tools
external.description: Tools and games provided by other researchers and game developers that are useful for evaluation, experimentation, and development will also be presented.
